data.title: Search using regex only searches open documents
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.17.0-insider (Commit 67a8479bdcb95b3e21959342663b828d97f2098f)
- OS Version: Linux 4.12.13-1-ARCH #1 SMP PREEMPT Fri Sep 15 06:36:43 UTC 2017 x86_64 GNU/Linux


Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a folder and ensure all editors are closed.
2. Open search, enable regex search and search for "\n" - You should get 0 results.
3. Open a few files in editors and search again, populated results will consist of only the open documents.

Note: sometimes it populates with just a single file, cannot consistently reproduce this.
 
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Fine grained configuration change events

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently configuration service fires a change event and do not provide what part of configuration has changed. It will be effective and performant for the consumers to know what part of configuration has changed and react to it.

* [ ] a fine-grained configuration change event that allows consumer to check what settings have changed
* [ ] adoption in the listeners

data.title: 'When' clause contexts are ignored for shortcuts that toggle panels or sidebar
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (f7962f0682a76516df51de4856f8ccc5d8ad578a, 2017-09-20T05:24:33.599Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601
- Extensions: none
---

Key bindings for commands that toggle sidebar or panel visibility ignore 'when' clause contexts, making it impossible to limit them to certain contexts.

**Use case:** some shortcut schemes (e.g. Intellij IDEA) have a shortcut to hide current active sidebar or panel, and [a VScode extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=k--kato.intellij-idea-keybindings) that provides such keybindings wants to recreate this functionality [through a shortcut that toggles panels and the sidebar only when they are active](
https://github.com/k--kato/vscode-intellij-idea-keybindings/blob/196930a21d640292fba481200489234a272220e1/package.json#L771-L807), essentially turning a toggle into a closer. But since 'when' clause contexts for these actions always evaluate to true, the shortcuts become globally active and act as toggles. And while the last three shortcuts from that snippet are replaceable with a global shortcut for `workbench.action.closePanel`, there is no corresponding action to close (not toggle) the sidebar.

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Pick an unused shortcut, e.g. `ctrl+l`, and a context that would be inactive during the next steps, e.g. `parameterHintsVisible`.
2. Add any one of the following settings to `keybindings.json`:
```json
{ "key": "ctrl+l",                "command": "workbench.action.toggleSidebarVisibility",
                                     "when": "parameterHintsVisible" }
```
```json
{ "key": "ctrl+l",                "command": "workbench.action.togglePanel",
                                     "when": "parameterHintsVisible" }
```
```json
{ "key": "ctrl+l",                "command": "workbench.actions.view.problems",
                                     "when": "parameterHintsVisible" }
```
```json
{ "key": "ctrl+l",                "command": "workbench.debug.action.toggleRepl",
                                     "when": "parameterHintsVisible" }
```
```json
{ "key": "ctrl+l",                "command": "workbench.action.terminal.toggleTerminal",
                                     "when": "parameterHintsVisible" }
```
3. Set focus to the current text editor.
4. Press `ctrl+l`.

**Expected result:** nothing should happen, the 'when' clause evaluates to false so the shortcut should be disabled.
**Actual result:** the shortcut works, the relevant panel/sidebar visibility is toggled.

data.title: Update tweet message limit. Fixes #35214
data.body: Twitter has updated their message limit to 280 characters. This commit updates the message text size.

data.title: Full stack traces are annoying
data.body: The devtools-console is showing the *full* stack trace of callers (calling console.log/warn/etc) and that's quite annoying as that is usually too much information. The top most stack element should be enough to identify the caller.

data.title: Cannot run oss tool because of markdown's npm-shrinkwrap.json
data.body:
The oss tool does not work anymore, as it stumbles upon the new npm-shrinkwrap.json format, where at a field called `"version"`, which used to be a version number, the tool now finds an npm URI.

This breaking change was introduced via https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/a87c72f2dffe56dccc1c522b523449f67858583a

If you would like to use such a format in your npm-shrinkwrap.json, then please also update the oss tool to work with this new format.

data.title: Feeback popup shows incorrect amount of available characters(twitter raised the limit today)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:38:23.027Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
better-comments|aar|0.1.3
Bookmarks|ale|0.16.0
project-manager|ale|0.21.1
ng-template|Ang|0.1.7
npm-intellisense|chr|1.3.0
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
open-html-in-browser|cod|0.1.21
githistory|don|0.2.3
gitlens|eam|5.3.0
auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14
beautify|Hoo|1.1.1
vscode-git-tags|how|1.1.0
Go|luk|0.6.65
gitignore|mic|1.0.1
prettify-json|moh|0.0.3
vscode-versionlens|pfl|0.19.1
code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.3
react-beautify|tai|0.3.0
vscode-wakatime|Wak|1.1.16

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click smiley icon(feedback) at the bottom right
2. Observe that it shows that you have 117 characters available

With new limit you should have 257 characters available, here's the blog post https://blog.twitter.com/official/en_us/topics/product/2017/Giving-you-more-characters-to-express-yourself.html

Here's a screenshot in case It's not clear what I am referring to.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11031051/30906278-11d06966-a380-11e7-8aa4-7fe330d29b00.png)


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Intellisense and symbol search stops working in large Javascript project
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.16.1
- OS Version: Win10

We have a large JS project with approx. 8000 files. Since one of the latest releases the Intellisense (for all kinds of symbols, also DOM) stops working and also Symbol search (Ctrl-Shift-O). It will work for a few minutes, then it will only show "Loading..." or the loading animation of the search bar.
I noticed that the vscode process will allocate memory up to 1,2 GB and then go down to 500 MB again, (see the screenshot) and consumes 25-30% CPU. This continues for 1/2 hour. When "finished" the features works again, but only a few times until it starts over with "Loading..." and again the same CPU and memory usage.
It is also strange that my colleagues who use the same project are not affected by this issue.

![vscode_memory2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18584269/30904072-19c251e8-a371-11e7-9a95-a0bf7526f27d.PNG)

Steps to Reproduce: ?
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: workspace file conflict: compare content
data.body:
Testing #34775

- open a folder
- save the workspace to a new file
- open the workspace file in another editor, add
```
	"settings": {
		"workbench.colorTheme": "Monokai"
	}
```
- in VSCode, note that the theme color changes
- in VSCode, add a new workspace folder
- Error dialog comes up and says that the file has been modified in the background.

-> there should not be any conflicts here as the file seems to be tracked
-> non-conflicting changes should be resolvable without a merge editor

data.title: Visual studio code intellisense is very slow
data.body:
Hi, 

Visual Studio Code intellisense is very slow. Sometime it dont provide intellisense after waiting by pressing CTRL + SPACE and most of time it keeps showing loading.

Following is my tsconfig.json file
```
{
  "extends": "../tsconfig.json",
  "compilerOptions": {
    "outDir": "../out-tsc/app",
    "baseUrl": "./",
    "module": "es2015",
    "types": []
  },
  "exclude": [
    "test.ts",
    "**/*.spec.ts",
    "node_modules",
    "typings/main.d.ts",
    "typings/main"
  ]
}

```

data.title: VS Code freezes on editing jsdoc
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.16.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit jsdoc that has something=[]
2. Put opening [ before `something`
3. VSCode freezes

Example: 
```
* @param {object[]} something=[] Some description
```

Changing to
```
* @param {object[]} [something=[] Some description
```

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: SCM: some git.exe hang in git-remote-https
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a folder with many git repositories inside
2. I got asked if I want to permit VS Code access to my keychain and said "yes"

Notice how many git processes seem to hang in git-remote-https, not returning. I am also not seeing a login popup from VS Code either:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/30900796-91694eec-a365-11e7-9526-473ef1110221.png)

My git config:

```ini
[credential]
	helper = osxkeychain
```

data.title: Open Folder always use existing window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d)
- OS Version: Kubuntu 17.04 (Linux desktop 4.10.0-35-generic #39-Ubuntu SMP Wed Sep 13 07:46:59 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a folder in an existing VSCode window
2. press ctrl-shift-n to open a new vscode window
3. in the new window, click the "Open Folder" blue button on the Explorer pane to open the SAME folder as in the first code instance.

The folder refused to be opened in the second window, and the first window is focused.   This issue seems to be reported multiple times, before reporting, I have followed suggestions in history by editing my configuration:

    "window.openFoldersInNewWindow": "on",

However, it seems not working.  The reason I need to open two window is that I want to show two Code instance on two monitors so that I can reference code easily.   As a matter of fact, I don't know the rationale to prevent two code instance of the same folder??

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: SCM: lots of git processes hanging around after quitting
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a folder with many git repositories as children
2. see your CPU go flying

![screen shot 2017-09-27 at 09 21 10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/30900702-4ad0bf6a-a365-11e7-9843-52bbf40e8743.png)

These processes were hanging around even after I quit VS Code. I had to reboot my machine to get out of very high CPU/memory consumption.
